result.execSummary:
Freddie S McDaniels was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Freddie S McDaniels was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Freddie S McDaniels

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Freddie S McDaniels not in court, defendant in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has been turned over to the State of Minnesota on 5-26-2022
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Freddie S McDaniels in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Freddie S McDaniels in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom. Defense Counsel appears in court with a signed waiver of extradition. Court accepts the waiver. Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Minnesota.  Defendant waived extradition. Court orders case remain calendared for status conference on 06-10-2022 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Freddie S McDaniels not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared for status conference, 06-10-2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 2.

Defendant Freddie S McDaniels in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Freddie S McDaniels in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Freddie S McDaniels appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of MINNESOTA.
Defendant contested extradition.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Defense counsel request bail hearing to address remand. 
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Criminal Warrant for Commitment.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
